title: Domain 2.9: Given a scenario, configure appropriate security settings on small office/home office (SOHO) wireless and wired networks.
content:
🏠 Home Router Settings (SOHO Security)

  • 🔑 Change default passwords: Prevent unauthorized access by replacing default admin credentials with strong, unique ones.
  • 🌐 IP filtering: Restrict network access by whitelisting specific IP addresses.
  • 🧬 Firmware updates: Regular updates patch security flaws and enhance performance.
  • 🧱 Content filtering: Block access to certain websites or categories (e.g., adult, gambling).
  • 📍 Physical placement/secure locations: Central, secured placement reduces tampering and signal leakage.
  • 📡 DHCP reservations: Assign fixed IPs to key devices like printers or cameras.
  • 🌍 Static WAN IP: Useful for consistent remote access, VPNs, or port forwarding.
  • 🔁 Universal Plug and Play (UPnP): Disable unless necessary—can automatically open security risks.
  • 🛡️ Screened subnet (DMZ): Isolate public-facing devices to protect your internal network.

📶 Wireless Specific Settings

  • 🆔 Changing the SSID: Rename your Wi-Fi network to something unique and unidentifiable.
  • 🕵️ Disabling SSID Broadcast: Adds minor stealth, though not foolproof.
  • 🔐 Encryption Settings: Use WPA2 or WPA3 for secure wireless communication. Avoid WEP.
  • 🚫 Disabling Guest Access: Disable unless needed. Use restrictions if enabled.
  • 📻 Changing Channels: Avoids interference from nearby networks—especially useful in apartments.

🔥 Firewall Settings

  • 🔌 Disabling Unused Ports: Reduce exposure by closing unnecessary ports (e.g., RDP).
  • 🗺️ Port Forwarding/Mapping: Redirect traffic only when needed—secure and monitor carefully.
